title: Footnotes - Northwestern University
content: In this issue: new discoveries from old materials in the Music Library, the role of libraries providing e-resources, and Northwestern's favorite director Garry Marshall Two recent exhibitions featuring rare materials from the Music Library led to the unearthing of a rare Gregorian plainchant document and brought sounds alive that haven’t been heard since the 18th century. A fall exhibition at the Libraries showcases the archive of prolific director and irrepressible joke-teller Garry Marshall.  Marshall's influence on American pop culture is vast and undeniable, as was his love of Northwestern. Share your story, update your information, or support the Libraries.
